title: Sculptor's Model of a Royal Head
credit_line: Gift of Evangeline Wilbour Blashfield, Theodora Wilbour, and Victor Wilbour honoring the wishes of their mother, Charlotte Beebe Wilbour, as a memorial to their father, Charles Edwin Wilbour
section: The Ptolemaic Period and the Beginning of the Roman Period

museum_location.name: This item is not on view

rights_type.name: Creative Commons 3D
rights_type.description: You may download and use Brooklyn Museum images of this three-dimensional work in accordance with a Creative Commons license. completeness.name: Good
completeness.description: Most data is approved, but records have not been fully vetted. Many objects have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.title: 16.76, 33.591, 16.50, 70.91.2, 82.22
labels.content: The slight smile, the soft facial features, and the downward-pointing viper on the brow (where there would normally be a rearing cobra)of some of these images suggest that they represent one or more of the kings of the fourth century B.C.E. Whether sculptors' models or temple offerings (see case label), they illustrate the diversity contained in and the problems associated with this well-attested category of Egyptian art. For example, the busts appear to be temple offerings, but several of them have artists' working marks such as L-shaped depth guides (70.91.2) or a grid pattern (16.76).

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
